thread.title: Former Maryland football coach Edsall releases statement

title: Former Maryland football coach Edsall releases statement
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Former Maryland football coach Edsall releases statement "On behalf of myself and my family I want to thank everyone for giving me the opportunity to be part of the University of Maryland as its football coach. Post to Facebook Former Maryland football coach Edsall releases statement "On behalf of myself and my family I want to thank everyone for giving me the opportunity to be part of the University of Maryland as its football coach.  //on.wusa9.com/1RDCvq8   Join the Conversation To   Former Maryland football coach Edsall releases statement WUSA 9 Staff, WUSA 10:17 p.m. EDT October 12, 2015 Maryland Terrapins head coach Randy Edsall during the third quarter against the Wisconsin Badgers at Camp Randall Stadium. Wisconsin won 52-7. (Photo: Jeff Hanisch-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
COLLEGE PARK, Md. (WUSA9) -- Former University of Maryland football coach Randy Edsall released a statement Monday night thanking the university community for the opportunity to coach the team. 
"On behalf of myself and my family I want to thank everyone for giving me the opportunity to be part of the University of Maryland as its football coach," Edsall said in the statement. 
Edsall was fired Sunday after a 28-49 loss to Ohio State on Saturday. Since becoming Maryland coach in 2011, Edsall went 22-34. The Terps have also been outscored 122-34 in their last three games. 
Offensive Coordinator Mike Locksley has been named interim head coach. 
Edsall's full statement is below. 
"On behalf of myself and my family I want to thank everyone for giving me the opportunity to be part of the University of Maryland as its football coach. I am proud of the great progress we made with our student-athletes, not just on the field but in the community and the classroom. We take away a lot of great memories during our stay here at College Park and wish everyone the best in the coming months and years." 
Like this story? Like WUSA9 on Facebook .
